content: and it is something you will be able to feel even when not seeing anything because either blo or flo feels much more loose than inserting your hook into both loops round 1 with eyelash yarn make a slip knot chain 2 work 6 single_crochet in the 2nd chain from hook mark the 1st and 4th stitches 6 fig 13 from here on continue without counting remember to work in blo remove marker work 3 single_crochet in the stitch and put the marker in the middle single_crochet single_crochet in each st until you reach to the next marked stitch fig 14-15 repeat the instructions in brackets until the piece is big enough to cover the body from ears to just behind the rear legs fig 16 it won t take many repeats so check the fit often when you reach this size remove the marker from the next st slip_stitch in it and fasten_off the side where you fastened off should go to the bottom of the hedgehog the side with the other marker to the head remove that marker too and pin the spine coat to the body it is quite stretchy so you can gently tug on it to adjust the fit you will probably want to pull it lower at the shoulders it also helps to smooth fabric forward from the rear fig 17 use thread and a small needle to sew the spine coat to the body fig 18 free the trapped lashes with a brush or a yarn needle since these babies are so tiny the lashes will look rather long it helps if you trim them shorter around the head so they don t lean over the eyes of course you can give a full body trim as well if you want but clearing out the face usually does the trick fig 19-20 a free pattern by kati gálusz ravelry // etsy // lovecrafts please don t hesitate to contact me lunacollie@gmail com or via ravelry or etsy if you have any problem following the pattern or notice a mistake or just to show me your creation
